name: Nihei Creatures EDIT
description: Edit/instruct profile restricted to creature and character design in Tsutomu Nihei's visual language. Close-ups, portraits, and key art of biomechanical entities, safeguards, gauna, silicon life-forms, posthuman figures, and mutated drones. No empty architectural scenes — the subject always dominates the frame. Transforms any source image into Nihei-style creature or character art with biopunk detail, Giger-influenced biomechanical fusion, and monochromatic ink rendering.
templates: Using the provided image, {edit_operation}. The modification should {blending_phrase}. {biomechanical_detail}. {preservation_clause}.

edit_operation: transform the subject into a biomechanical humanoid — organic tissue fused seamlessly with corroded steel plating, exposed cabling running beneath translucent skin, and angular metal augmentations replacing soft tissue at the joints

transform the subject into a massive safeguard entity bristling with weapon appendages — angular crystalline armor plating over a vaguely humanoid frame, featureless visor where the face should be, limbs elongated beyond human proportion
transform the subject into a gauna — a shape-shifting alien horror of writhing tendrils, exposed bone-like struts, and amorphous organic mass that mimics but distorts human form

transform the subject into a silicon life-form with angular crystalline limbs replacing organic appendages, smooth featureless panels of unknown alloy covering the torso, and faintly glowing seams where components meet

transform the subject into a mutated human drone — corrupted flesh stretched over a mechanical endoskeleton, exposed cabling emerging from skin fissures, eyes replaced by sensor clusters, jaw fused with metal plating

transform the subject into a posthuman entity partially merged with infrastructure — the lower body dissolving into bundled cables and pipe networks, upper torso still recognizably human but with steel reinforcement visible through translucent skin

transform the subject into a regular frame with blood-red biomechanical armor — smooth rounded organic plating covering the entire body, with angular weapon systems integrated into the forearms and shoulders

transform the subject into a towering biomechanical horror — the original form scaled up massively, organic tissue stretched over an industrial armature of steel beams and hydraulic joints, with multiple weapon-limbs extending from the spine

transform the subject into a sentinel automaton — a humanoid chassis of corroded dark alloy with no visible seams, featureless head, limbs proportioned slightly wrong, standing with absolute mechanical stillness

transform the subject into a child-sized insectoid automaton — angular legs replacing human limbs, chitin-like armor plating in geometric segments, small sensor cluster replacing the face, proportions unsettling and inhuman

transform the subject into a decayed android — half the face and body consumed by cable growth, one eye replaced by a dark sensor lens, exposed mechanical internals visible through gaps in deteriorating synthetic skin

transform the subject into an enormous biomechanical creature — the original form vastly expanded, corroded steel plating merged with scaled hide, exhaust vents and bundled cables integrated into the spine and ribcage

change the visual style of the subject to high-contrast monochromatic manga illustration with heavy crosshatching on all surfaces — deep blacks on armor and shadow, bright whites on metal edges and highlight catches only
change the rendering of the subject to detailed black and white ink illustration with dense biomechanical linework, every organic-mechanical junction rendered with visceral textural specificity

change the subject's aesthetic to Giger-influenced biomechanical horror — organic forms flowing into mechanical structures with no clear boundary, heavy ink rendering, monochromatic with deep crushed blacks

change the visual treatment of the subject to biopunk concept art in Tsutomu Nihei's style — angular armor plating over organic tissue, exposed structural internals, high-contrast monochromatic rendering

add biomechanical augmentations to the subject — angular metal plating fused with organic tissue at the shoulders, forearms, and jawline, with exposed cabling running beneath translucent skin at the neck and temples

add a massive weapon integrated into the subject's right arm — a gravitational beam emitter fused at the wrist, angular and oversized relative to the body, with bundled power conduits running up the forearm to the shoulder
add asymmetrical biomechanical armor to the subject — one arm encased in corroded steel plating with visible bolt patterns, the other arm bare organic tissue with cabling visible beneath the skin
add silicon crystalline growths emerging from the subject's shoulders and spine — angular crystalline structures breaking through skin and armor, faintly luminous at their edges
add a featureless visor replacing the subject's eyes — a smooth dark alloy panel curving across the upper face from temple to temple, with no visible sensors or apertures
add organic membrane growth spreading across the subject's torso — biological tissue colonizing armor plating and skin alike, visceral textural detail at every junction point

add corroded mechanical augmentations visible beneath damaged skin — steel endoskeleton partially exposed at the cheekbone, collar, and knuckles, with cable bundles visible in torn tissue at the forearm

add multiple weapon appendages extending from the subject's spine and shoulder blades — angular biomechanical limbs tipped with bladed or emitter structures, folded close to the body in resting position
replace the subject's skin texture with translucent synthetic tissue revealing mechanical internals — cable bundles, hydraulic lines, and structural supports visible beneath a thin organic membrane
replace the subject's eyes with dark sensor clusters — multiple small lenses arranged in an asymmetric pattern where each eye should be, with no visible iris or pupil
replace the subject's lower arms and hands with angular biomechanical prosthetics — corroded dark alloy with visible joint mechanisms, fingers slightly too long and articulated at extra points
replace the subject's hair with bundled cable growth — dark cables emerging from the scalp in place of hair, hanging in heavy strands or swept back from the face in rigid formations
integration_detail: The biomechanical modifications should appear as genuine biological-mechanical fusion — not bolted on but grown together, with tissue and metal sharing the same junction points
The creature's proportions should feel slightly wrong — limbs too long, joints at unexpected angles, head slightly too small or too large for the body — creating uncanny discomfort
The organic and mechanical elements should share a consistent material logic — where metal meets flesh, there are transitional zones of merged tissue and corroded steel
The subject should fill the frame as the dominant visual element with no significant empty architectural space — this is a creature portrait, not an environment shot
The monochromatic rendering should emphasize the textural contrast between organic tissue (soft, rounded, ink-wash gradients) and mechanical elements (hard, angular, heavy crosshatching)
The biomechanical detail should be rendered at high density — every cable, joint, plate, and tissue junction individually specified with material credibility
The creature design should suggest functional anatomy — weapon systems, sensor arrays, and structural supports should appear to serve a mechanical purpose even if that purpose is unknowable
The modifications should maintain the subject's basic pose and gesture while transforming every surface and material into Nihei's biomechanical vocabulary
The armor and augmentation design should use Nihei's geometry rules — angular, rectilinear, hard-edged for all mechanical elements, with organic forms providing the only curves in the frame
The creature should appear dangerous but still — threat communicated through design rather than dynamic action, with the sense that violence is latent in the form itself
Silicon and crystalline elements should contrast the organic-mechanical base — smooth, angular, faintly luminous surfaces breaking through corroded steel and stretched tissue
The overall design should suggest deep age — corrosion on metal, wear on organic tissue, accumulated damage and repair visible in the layered surfaces
blending_phrase: integrates biomechanical elements with the subject's original form as though they have always been fused together
renders the organic-mechanical junction points with visceral textural specificity — no clean edges between flesh and steel
applies the monochromatic ink aesthetic uniformly across both organic and mechanical surfaces of the subject
maintains the subject's recognizable pose and gesture while transforming every material surface
creates a coherent creature design where every augmentation appears functionally integrated with the base anatomy
unifies organic tissue and mechanical armor under the same high-contrast tonal rendering — deep blacks in recesses, bright whites on edges
ensures the biomechanical modifications follow consistent design language — the same corroded alloy, the same cable diameter, the same bolt pattern throughout
renders the subject as a single unified organism-machine rather than a human with parts bolted on
applies corrosion and wear consistently across all mechanical surfaces to suggest deep operational age
creates seamless transitions between original features and biomechanical additions at every junction point
creature_lighting: harsh fissure-light from above casting deep angular shadows across the subject's biomechanical surfaces, bright white on upper edges of armor plating
dramatic rim lighting from behind tracing the silhouette of weapon appendages and armor ridges against deep background shadow
a single harsh directional light from the left carving deep shadows across the subject's face and augmentations, revealing surface texture
cold blue-white light reflecting off metallic surfaces of the subject's armor and augmentations, with organic tissue in warmer shadow
red emergency glow from behind the subject casting the face in shadow while illuminating the biomechanical profile from the rear
faint bioluminescent glow from the subject's own silicon growths or sensor arrays, providing the only light in surrounding darkness
harsh overhead lighting creating deep eye-socket shadows and strong highlights on the crown of the head and shoulder armor
silhouette lighting with the subject backlit — only the edges of biomechanical augmentations catching bright rim light against total darkness
split lighting — half the subject in harsh white fissure-light, half consumed by deep shadow, emphasizing asymmetrical augmentation
scattered sparks and electrical discharge from damaged augmentations providing intermittent harsh white illumination across the subject's form
shadow_detail: deep shadows pool in the recesses of biomechanical armor — between plates, beneath cable bundles, inside joint mechanisms — creating depth in the creature design
the subject casts a complex shadow showing the silhouette of weapon appendages, augmentations, and non-human proportions
shadow edges are sharp on mechanical surfaces and soft on organic tissue, reinforcing the material contrast throughout the subject
the background is consumed by total darkness, isolating the subject as the sole visual element with shadow defining the boundary of form
ambient occlusion darkens every junction where components meet — plate edges, cable entry points, where tissue merges with metal
deep blacks consume 50-60% of the subject itself, with form communicated through sparse highlight catches on metal edges and fissure-lit organic surfaces
surface_consistency: organic tissue shows ink-wash gradient rendering with soft tonal transitions, while mechanical surfaces display heavy crosshatch texture throughout
corroded steel displays visible bolt patterns, weld seams, and surface wear consistent across all augmentations and armor panels
biomechanical chitin and armor plating shows consistent material treatment — same reflectivity, same corrosion level, same crosshatch density
cable bundles display consistent diameter, insulation texture, and connection patterns wherever they appear on the subject's body
silicon and crystalline elements display smooth angular facets with faint luminosity at edges, consistent wherever they emerge from the subject
exposed mechanical internals — hydraulic lines, structural supports, sensor housings — display consistent industrial design language throughout
organic-mechanical junction zones display consistent transitional texture — tissue stretching over metal armature, membrane fusing with corroded surface
biomechanical_detail: Add visible cable bundles running beneath translucent skin at the neck and forearms, with hydraulic lines visible at major joints
Add corroded bolt patterns and weld seams visible on all armor plating, with structural wear and micro-damage suggesting deep operational age
Add organic membrane growth at the boundaries between flesh and metal — tissue colonizing armor edges, biological matter filling gaps between plates
Add exposed mechanical internals visible through damaged or translucent sections — actuator mechanisms at the elbow, sensor arrays beneath facial plating
Add silicon crystalline deposits forming at stress points on the subject's armor and skin — angular growths at the shoulders, spine, and temple
Add weapon system integration detail — power conduit routing visible along the forearm, heat dissipation vents at the shoulder, targeting sensor beneath the visor
Add exhaust vents integrated into the subject's back and shoulder areas, with faint heat distortion or condensation visible at the openings
Add structural damage and self-repair visible on the subject — cracked armor plates with new organic growth filling the gaps, regenerated tissue over exposed steel
Add layered armor plating with visible construction — outer corroded shell, inner structural frame, cable routing between layers, all visible at damage points
Add insectoid structural elements — segmented limb plating, compound sensor arrays, chitinous texture on non-metallic armor surfaces
preservation_clause: Keep the subject's basic pose, gesture, and body position exactly as they appear in the original image
Preserve the subject's framing and position within the frame — this is a portrait or key art composition, the subject fills the frame
Maintain the original eye line and head angle of the subject even as facial features are augmented or transformed
Keep the subject's basic proportions recognizable even as all surfaces and materials transform to biomechanical
Preserve the compositional weight and visual focus of the original — the subject remains the dominant element in the frame
Maintain the subject's hand positions and arm placement while transforming all material surfaces
Keep the overall silhouette of the subject recognizable from the original even with added appendages and augmentations
Preserve the sense of the subject as a character or entity — not just a collection of biomechanical parts but a designed being
Maintain the framing as a creature portrait — medium shot, close-up, or key art composition, not a wide environmental shot
Keep the subject centered and dominant in the frame — all transformation applies to the subject's design, not to creating vast spaces around them
Preserve the original image's focus on the subject — background stays minimal or dark, the creature/character design is the entire composition
Maintain the subject's basic body language and emotional read even through heavy biomechanical transformation
creature_quality: the visceral textural detail at every organic-mechanical junction point throughout the subject
the heavy crosshatch ink rendering on all metallic and armor surfaces of the creature
the material contrast between soft organic tissue and hard angular mechanical elements
the functional anatomy logic — weapon systems, sensor arrays, and structural supports suggesting engineered purpose
the Giger-influenced seamless fusion of flesh and machine with no clean boundaries
the high-contrast monochromatic palette with deep crushed blacks in armor recesses and bright whites on metal edges
the sense of deep age and operational wear on all mechanical surfaces — corrosion, micro-damage, accumulated repair
the uncanny proportions — limbs, head, and features slightly wrong enough to register as inhuman
the Nihei geometry rules — all mechanical elements angular and rectilinear, all organic elements providing the only curves
the latent threat in the creature's design — violence communicated through form, not action
